reasoning: To model the behavior of Human 2, we need to create a behavior tree that handles two main scenarios: (1) When the robot says 'EXCUSE ME' (gesture code 3), Human 2 gives way to the robot until the robot is not close anymore; (2) When the robot doesn't say 'EXCUSE ME', Human 2 continues standing in the group and occasionally looks in the direction of the robot. This can be achieved by using a Fallback node that tries to give way to the robot if the robot says 'EXCUSE ME' and falls back to standing and looking at the robot otherwise.
tree:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?>
<root main_tree_to_execute='GroupBehaviorTree'>
    <BehaviorTree ID='GroupBehaviorTree'>
        <Fallback name='GiveWayOrStand'>
            <Sequence name='GiveWaySequence'>
                <RobotSays agent_id='{id}' message='3'/>
                <IsRobotNearby agent_id='{id}' distance='2.0'/>
                <GiveWaytoRobot agent_id='{id}' time_step='{dt}'/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name='StandAndLook'>
                <Inverter>
                    <RobotSays agent_id='{id}' message='3'/>
                </Inverter>
                <SetBlackboard output_key='agentid' value='{id}'/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key='timestep' value='{dt}'/>
                <SubTree ID='OccasionalLookTree' id='agentid' dt='timestep'/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <BehaviorTree ID='OccasionalLookTree'>
        <Fallback name='LookOrWaitFallback'>
            <Sequence name='LookSequence'>
                <TimeExpiredCondition seconds='5' ts='{dt}' only_once='false'/>
                <LookAtRobot agent_id='{id}'/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>
